name: Sadegh Hedayat in Père Lachaise cemetery, Paris, France.
description:
Me before quarantine.

Sadeq Hedayat,  Iranian author who introduced modernist techniques into Persian fiction. He is considered one of the greatest Iranian writers of the 20th century.
Sadegh Hedayat was an Iranian writer, translator and intellectual, who introduced modernist techniques into Iranian history. He is considered one of the greatest Iranian writers of the twentieth century.
He is best known for his novel The Blind Owl.
He died in Paris in 1951 and was buried in Perlashes Cemetery.
